content: double thick potholder tutorial ©2004 materials 1 oz color a worsted wt 100% cotton yarn 1 oz color b worsted wt 100% cotton yarn sz h crochet hook special stitches blo - back loop only work the stitch into *only* the farthest loop from you 2 row single_crochet - two row single_crochet insert hook into back loop of current stitch then into the unused loop of row directly below yarn over draw through 2 loops yarn over draw through two loops 2 row single_crochet made pattern with color a chain 35 row 1 single_crochet in the 2nd chain from hook and each chain across chain 1 turn 34 single_crochet 34 single_crochet row 2 in blo single_crochet in each single_crochet across chain 1 turn 34 single_crochet row 3-13 work 2 row single_crochet in each stitch across chain 1 turn 34 2 row scs ** be sure to get that last 2rowsc in each row- it can be easy to miss** row 14 work 2 row single_crochet in each st across until the last stitch in last stitch insert hook in blo of this row and row below yarn over and draw through two then drop old color don t cut it - draw it around to the front yarn over with new color and draw through two loops to complete stitch chain 1 turn changing colors if you do not do this twist with the old yarn your edge will not be tight and neat don t skip this little trick to lock in the colors row 15 & 16 repeat row 3 with color b on final stitch of row 16 change to color a as done in row 14 remember to pull old color to front before joining on new color chain 1 turn row 17 & 18 repeat row 3 with color a on final stitch of row 18 change to change to color b as done in row 14 chain 1 turn if your yarn balls are getting twisted pick up one and untangle it from the other one row 19 & 20 repeat row 15 & 16 row 21 & 22 repeat row 17 & 18 row 23 & 24 repeat row 15 & 16 row 25 & 26 repeat row 17 & 18 row 27-39 repeat row 3 with color b row 40 insert hook in both stitches of next st and then down into unused loop of row below yo draw through 3 loops yo draw through 2 loops finishing 2 row single_crochet made work finishing 2row single_crochet across - using *both loops* and *unused loop* in each stitch end off and work in all ends please note all of my patterns are free for your use you may print out as many as you wish and i encourage you to share with friends please keep my name and copyright mark with all my patterns please do not post this to any email list and please don t post this on any other website
